definition: to change the laws/political reform/unconventional method
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Shang Yang's political reform of Qin state 秦國|秦国 of 356 BC and 350 BC, that put it on the road to world domination
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to try by all available methods

sentences.english: It is actually reflection of this view that she cruelly kept down the Movement of 1898.
sentences.chinese: 她殘酷地鎮壓戊戌變法運動就是這一基本思想的反映。

sentences.english: The fifth part analyses the impact of Wang Anshi's personality characteristics over the political reform' success and failure.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分分析了王安石的個性特徵對變法成敗的影響。

sentences.english: Liang, once a student of Kang's, helped Kang by writing articles propagating reformist ideas.
sentences.chinese: 康有爲的學生梁啓超協助撰寫文章，宣傳變法思想。

sentences.english: He inspired Chinese scholars with his writings and reform movements.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章和變法運動激勵著一代代中國學者。

sentences.english: The first item of his political reform is to reorganize the breakdown of law and order.
sentences.chinese: 他變法的第一項內容就是要整頓陵替的法制。

sentences.english: The composition ratios of inclusion compounds were obtained by the continuous variation method.
sentences.chinese: 用連續遞變法測定了包合物的組成摩爾比。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi's theory of "New Learning" served as his theoretical basis in introducing the "New Laws".
sentences.chinese: “荊公新學”是王安石變法的理論基礎。

sentences.english: The Reform Movement of 1898 is a revolutionary movement of bourgeois nature.
sentences.chinese: 戊戌變法是一次資產階級性質的革命運動。
